rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to identify the show for us.)

clues.text: "I don't know how to love him, what to do, how to move him"
"Kiss today goodbye and point me t'ward tomorrow, we did what we had to do"
"High flying, adored, that's good to hear but unimportant... local girl makes good weds famous man"
"525,600 minutes--how do you measure, measure a year?"
"The accuracy of the dreams we brothers do not know...one thing we are sure about the dreamer has to go"

1306 to 1329:
Robert the Bruce

1523 to 1560:
Gustav I Vasa

1886 to 1931:
Alfonso XIII

1704 to 1709 & back for round 2 from 1733 to 1734:
Stanislaw I

1946 to 1951:
Abdullah I (he cut "Trans" from the country's name mid-reign)
This 20th century composer described his "Bolero" as "work for orchestra without music"
His greatest orchestral work, "La Mer", was inspired by artists Claude Monet & J.M.W. Turner
Wagner called this "Symphonie Fantastique" composer the "savior of our modern world of absolute music"
In 1876 this composer of "Orpheus in the Underworld" went bankrupt; he toured the U.S. to recoup his losses
When this "Danse macabre" composer died on December 16, 1921, France called for a national day of mourning
Robert E. Lee's nephew Major General Fitzhugh Lee was governor of this state from 1886 to 1890
In "Pride and Prejudice", Fitzwilliam is the first name of this aristocratic gent
Winning Grammys for Pop Vocal Female for 1958, '59, '60 & '62, she got awards to fill a green & yellow basket
This freighter that tragically sank in Lake Superior in 1975 was named for a Milwaukee civic leader
In 1897 Bob Fitzsimmons won the world's heavyweight title by knocking out this "Gentleman" in 14 rounds
The White House's Diplomatic Reception Room was the site of his famous "Fireside Chats"
Amos Alonzo Stagg was no dummy; he invented the football tackling dummy at this New Haven university
This memorial that proves that 4 heads are better than one is also called the Shrine of Democracy
It's the reason Kansas has 34 stars on its state seal
clues.response: the number of states at the time it came into the Union

clues.text: The eastern part of this "Palmetto State" is the Low Country, & the western part is the Up Country
His 1930 book "Little America" is an account of his flight to the South Pole
On Dec. 17, 1911 he left the South Pole, leaving behind a tent & the Norwegian flag
An Antarctic sea & ice shelf are named for this man who discovered the North Magnetic Pole
In the 1950s this New Zealand mountaineer blazed a trail for Sir Vivian Fuchs, the first to cross Antarctica
The last entry in this Briton's diary, dated March 29, 1912, ended, "For God's sake look after our people"
In March 1997 he got a new costume: hot white & blue, no cape & an S like a lightning bolt
Simon Templar's initials give you an abbreviation for this, his nickname
This Dumas hero who left home at age 16 to be a Musketeer was based on a real person
Trapped by a cave-in after World War I, gases preserved him & he awoke in the 25th century
First names of detective Fenton Hardy's adventurous sons

The tiny nation of Andorra is located in the Pyrenees Mountains between France & this country
Lake Disappointment is a dry salt lake on the edge of this country's Gibson Desert
The name of this area of the Pacific is from the Greek for "many islands"
Sharing its name with a seaport in Yemen, this gulf provides a link between the Red Sea & the Arabian Sea
The city of Nizhny Novgorod in Russia was formerly known by this name, after a famous Communist writer
He began a correspondence with Elizabeth Barrett in 1845 & a year later they were married
He must have had a "Howl"ing good time performing on one of the Clash's albums
He completed a sonnet "On His Blindness" circa 1655 & one "On His Deceased Wife" in 1658
A bit of an eccentric, this poet & sister of astronomer Percival was often seen smoking cigars
"Double Persephone" was the first book of poetry by this Canadian author of "The Handmaid's Tale"
For luck Kate will only knock on this wood
Stewart pulls one out when a fly goes by
Carole consults one of these each time she visits Greece
For a question to this answer, Gustave doesn't even have this kind of idea
Rosaline adjusts these before landing her Cessna
Title character who says, "I made him know his name should be Friday, which was the day I saved his life"
This Anne Rice character laments, "If I'm starved for blood I look like a perfect horror"
This Sinclair Lewis realtor dreams "of the Fairy Child, a dream more romantic than scarlet pagodas"
In "To Kill a Mockingbird", it's the nickname of Atticus Finch's 6-year-old daughter Jean Louise
Madame Guishar, who "drifted continually from lover to lover" is the mother of this "Doctor Zhivago" heroine

rounds.text: Since 1991 this country has had only 3 different presidents; the current one took over in 2012 for the second time
